page.title: 18KIDSGROVE TOWN HALL
page.content: On Monday, June 17th.1985 we went to the Town Hall to find out what it was used for and how long it has been there. The Town Hall is a large building in Liverpool Rd. It was built in 1897 by Charles Cope, builders and the foundation stone was laid on April 22nd. by John Smith,Chairman of the Council. There are 2 shields above the door with kids playing among trees. That is how Kidsgrove gets its name. The Town Hall is used for paying bills,enquiries and Town Council meetings. There is also the magistrates court and the Youth and Community Centre. Just across the road is a school built in 1853 and named after Thomas Kinnersley, a benefactor. BY SHARON WOOD, AGED 11 YEARS
